item.title: Lost Mongolic Numerals
item.description: Despite Mongolic being a relatively young language family, there are a surprising amount of archaisms and innovations one can spot even in basic vocabulary such as numerals. With recent findings in the field, supported by data from neighboring languages, these numerals’ history are beginning to be understood. The biggest aid has been the deciphering of Khitan, a language of a sister branch to Mongolic, which helps reconstruct a deeper layer of Mongolic-Khitan languages (referred to also as Serbi-Mongolic).
